bestBHT.bht: They were helpless and unable to present a counterargument. Reluctantly, they had to admit that they prioritized their possessions and even their loved ones over the desperate man before them. Jesus' reasoning resonated with their own values of justice, equity, mercy, and humanity, shutting their mouths and leaving them exposed. Their inability to respond without exposing their hypocrisy fueled their growing resentment towards Him.

Philip Schaff: Luke 14:6. And they could not. The argument was conclusive. Thus thwarted and overcome, they doubtless hated Him the more.
Archibald T. Robertson: They could not take up the argument and were helpless.
They hated to admit that they cared more for an ox or ass or even a son than for this poor dropsical man.
John Gill: The justice, equity, mercy, and humanity that appeared in our Lord's reasonings...
...being agreeable to their own tenets and practices...
...their mouths were shut up, and they could not return an answer to them, without being exposed.

bhtAttempts.bht: The individuals in this verse were rendered speechless and powerless when faced with the argument presented by Jesus. It was difficult for them to accept that they valued their possessions, such as livestock or even their own children, more than they cared for the well-being of the afflicted man in front of them. Consequently, they resented Jesus even more for exposing their hypocrisy. His reasoning resonated with principles of justice, fairness, compassion, and humanity that aligned with their own beliefs and customs, leaving them with no compelling counterargument.

They were left speechless and powerless, unable to refute the truth presented by Jesus. The painful realization that they placed more value on their possessions, even their own children, than on the well-being of the afflicted man caused them to resent Him. His reasoning aligned with principles of justice, equity, mercy, and humanity that resonated with their own beliefs and practices, leaving them exposed and without a valid response.

Confronted by Jesus, they found themselves at a loss for words, unable to counter His argument. The uncomfortable truth that they prioritized their possessions, even over the welfare of a suffering man, bred resentment. His reasoning tapped into notions of justice, equity, mercy, and humanity that mirrored their own convictions and behavior, leaving them exposed and unable to respond.

Rendered helpless, they hated to acknowledge that their attachment to material possessions outweighed their concern for a vulnerable man. Their silence stemmed from the fact that Jesus' reasoning aligned with their own principles of justice, equity, mercy, and humanity, leaving them incapable of formulating a rebuttal without exposing their hypocrisy. The argument proved conclusive, intensifying their disdain towards Jesus, who had effectively exposed their self-serving sentiments.

They were helpless and unable to present a counterargument. Reluctantly, they had to admit that they prioritized their possessions and even their loved ones over the desperate man before them. Jesus' reasoning resonated with their own values of justice, equity, mercy, and humanity, shutting their mouths and leaving them exposed. Their inability to respond without exposing their hypocrisy fueled their growing resentment towards Him.
